name: Atuona Morning #078
description: ATUONA Gallery of Moments - Atuona Morning. Underground poetry preserved on blockchain. Free collection - true to underground values. Desire

attributes.value:
Кира проснулась от жары.
Простыни прилипли к коже, как второе платье.
Through the shutters — Atuona morning, thick as honey.
The air tastes of frangipani and rust.
Она думала о вчерашнем —
как Уле смотрел на неё в самолёте.
Не так, как смотрят на fashion editor.
Как смотрят на женщину.
"Je cherche toujours," — писал Гоген.
I am always searching.
На столике — её записи.
Разбросанные, как после показа Galliano.
Backstage chaos, но без адреналина.
Только тишина.
И эта проклятая жара.
She pulls the sheet away.
Skin meets air like first kiss.
В душе — тёплая вода, почти горячая.
Она думает о Милане.
О том показе Versace.
Донателла выпустила моделей в прозрачном тюле.
"Сила в уязвимости," — написала Кира тогда.
Front row applauded.
Nobody knew she was dying inside.
The water runs over her shoulders.
Salt from yesterday's tears, today's sweat.
All the same ocean.
Уле стучит в дверь:
"Завтрак через час. Потом — дом Гогена."
His voice through wood and water.
She imagines his hands.
В зеркале — её тело.
Не модельное, никогда таким не было.
Но здесь, в этом свете...
She sees what Gauguin might have painted.
Not Vogue beautiful.
Human beautiful.
Она выбирает платье.
Белый лён, простой крой.
Comme des Garçons, купленное в Токио.
Rei Kawakubo понимала:
пустота — это тоже форма.
The fabric falls like forgiveness.
За завтраком Уле молчит.
Но это другое молчание.
Charged, like air before storm.
Между ними — неназванное.
Растёт, как gravity between galaxies.
"Дом в двадцати минутах ходьбы," — наконец.
"Если вы готовы."
Кира кивает.
Готова ли она?
К дому мёртвого художника?
К картине, которой может не быть?
К тому, что происходит между ними?
The universe expands and contracts.
Time folds like origami.
"Пойдёмте," — она встаёт.
Платье касается кожи как обещание.

Kira woke to heat.
Sheets stuck to skin like a second dress.
Through the shutters — Atuona morning, thick as honey.
The air tastes of frangipani and rust.

She thought about yesterday —
how Ule looked at her on the plane.
Not how you look at a fashion editor.
How you look at a woman.

"Je cherche toujours," Gauguin wrote.
I am always searching.

On the nightstand — her notes.
Scattered like after a Galliano show.
Backstage chaos, but no adrenaline.
Just silence.
And this fucking heat.

She pulls the sheet away.
Skin meets air like first kiss.

The shower — warm water, almost hot.
She thinks of Milan.
That Versace show.
Donatella sent models out in sheer tulle.
"Power in vulnerability," Kira wrote then.
Front row applauded.
Nobody knew she was dying inside.

The water runs over her shoulders.
Salt from yesterday's tears, today's sweat.
All the same ocean.

Ule knocks on the door:
"Breakfast in an hour. Then — Gauguin's house."
His voice through wood and water.
She imagines his hands.

In the mirror — her body.
Not model body, never was.
But here, in this light...
She sees what Gauguin might have painted.
Not Vogue beautiful.
Human beautiful.

She chooses a dress.
White linen, simple cut.
Comme des Garçons, bought in Tokyo.
Rei Kawakubo understood:
emptiness is also form.

The fabric falls like forgiveness.

At breakfast Ule is quiet.
But it's a different silence.
Charged, like air before storm.
Between them — the unnamed.
Growing, like gravity between galaxies.

"The house is twenty minutes' walk," finally.
"If you're ready."

Kira nods.
Is she ready?
For a dead artist's house?
For a painting that might not exist?
For what's happening between them?

The universe expands and contracts.
Time folds like origami.

"Let's go," she stands.
The dress touches skin like a promise.
